body:
Comment 1: 
As requested here is the output from 10 passes of 100 runs of test/stack.go

Methodology:

% for j in {1..10} ; do (5g stack.go ; 5l stack.5 ; for i in {1..100} ; do  ./5.out 2>&1
; if [ $? -ne 0 ] ; then echo "FAIL $i" ; else echo "PASS $i" ; fi ; done) >
~/stack.out$j ; done

summary:

axentraserver(~) % grep -c FAIL stack.out* 
stack.out1:1
stack.out10:2
stack.out2:2
stack.out3:2
stack.out4:4
stack.out5:1
stack.out6:3
stack.out7:0
stack.out8:2
stack.out9:0
Attachments: 1. stack.out1 (10295 bytes) 1. stack.out2 (19798 bytes) 1. stack.out3 (19891 bytes) 1. stack.out4 (39176 bytes) 1. stack.out5 (5246 bytes) 1. stack.out6 (29301 bytes) 1. stack.out7 (792 bytes) 1. stack.out8 (19891 bytes) 1. stack.out9 (792 bytes) 1. stack.out10 (19823 bytes)
